page.title: 04LOCAL LANDMARKS
page.content: {Local Landmarks _______________ {Hampton Barns}is 150 to 200 years old.The person who lives there is Mr.Mottram Rankin.It is a large five bedroomed house.In the back garden is a large swimming pool.In 1963 they had a new wing built.Mr.Rankin breeds pheasants for shooting. There is a very old mansion called {Ragstone Lodge.}It was built in 1880.In a corner of the building there is a slab of stone which contains itemsfrom Queen Victoria's time. Next to Ragstone Lodge there is the {Rectory}this is a fairly new building and has had three rectors living in it up to the present time.Opposite the Rectory there is a sports ground and a hall which is called the{Memorial {Hall.}This is where local functions take place and sporting activities.
